there's this anterior convexity so it

two-thirds so let's say from about here
all the way down that medial two-thirds
that's gonna be convex anteriorly so
curved anteriorly and then the lateral
one-third is gonna be convex posteriorly
so it curves backwards so that's one
differentiating feature so if you want
to tell if it's a left or right clavicle
what you're gonna do you're gonna make
sure that the acromial end is distal the
sternal end is proximal and that there's
this anterior convexity for the the
proximal two-thirds and a lateral and
posterior convexity
and once you have it in that position
